charge_type.source:
Count 1 against the 1st defendant, So
So has pleaded guilty to conspiracy to traffic in a dangerous drug, namely, cocaine

drugs.source: For the 1st defendant, So, I will take into account the drugs found on her in her bag and that was 20.44 grammes of cocaine.

guilty_plea.source: The 1st and 2nd defendant of 317/2023 pleaded guilty to their respective charges at the earliest opportunity and were committed to the Court of First Instance for sentence

starting_point.source: those trafficking in 20.44 grammes of cocaine would attract a mathematical starting point of 5 years and 9 months’ imprisonment.

sentence_after_role.source: Inferred as starting point since role adjustment not provided

notional_sentence.source: those trafficking in 20.44 grammes of cocaine would attract a mathematical starting point of 5 years and 9 months’ imprisonment.

final_sentence.source: Therefore, for 317/2023, Count 1 against the 1st defendant, So, I intend to take a starting point of 5 years and 9 months and I will reduce it to 3 years’ imprisonment.

charge_type.source:
Count 2 against the 2nd defendant only, Lam
Lam has pleaded guilty to conspiracy to traffic in a dangerous drug, namely, cocaine and cannabis in a herbal form

drugs.source: For the 2nd defendant, Lam, I will take into account the cocaine found on him and the cocaine found in the premises rented by Fu and Lam which totals 109.19 grammes of cocaine.
There is 6 grammes of herbal cannabis, which I consider de minimis in the circumstances and therefore ignore it.

guilty_plea.source: The 1st and 2nd defendant of 317/2023 pleaded guilty to their respective charges at the earliest opportunity and were committed to the Court of First Instance for sentence

starting_point.source: those trafficking in 109.19 grammes of cocaine would attract a mathematical starting point of 9 years and 7 months’ imprisonment.

sentence_after_role.source: Inferred as starting point since role adjustment not provided

notional_sentence.source: those trafficking in 109.19 grammes of cocaine would attract a mathematical starting point of 9 years and 7 months’ imprisonment.

final_sentence.source: Lam is sentenced to 6 years and 4 months’ imprisonment.

charge_type.source:
Count 1 against the defendant, Fu
Fu now pleads guilty to conspiracy to traffic in a dangerous drug, namely, cocaine

drugs.source: For Fu, there is 20.44 grammes of cocaine he admits he delivered to So in relation to the 1st count he faces.

guilty_plea.source: Before his trial, this defendant reconsidered in light of the additional evidence against him and indicated a plea. He has pleaded guilty before me today

starting_point.source: As far as he is concerned, I can quantify a total of 26.63 grammes of cocaine. According to the latest sentencing guidelines, those trafficking in 26.63 grammes of cocaine would attract a mathematical starting point of 6 years and 3 months’ imprisonment.

sentence_after_role.source: Inferred as starting point since role adjustment not provided

notional_sentence.source: I intend to take a starting point of 6 years and 3 months’ imprisonment

final_sentence.source: Fu is sentenced to 4 years and 4 months’ imprisonment for Count 1.

charge_type.source:
Count 2
Fu now pleads guilty to trafficking in dangerous drugs on 3 October 2021

drugs.source: Fu now pleads guilty to trafficking in dangerous drugs ... he unlawfully trafficked in 7.2 grammes of a solid containing 6.19 grammes of cocaine
Fu now pleads guilty to trafficking in dangerous drugs ... and 6.12 grammes of cannabis in herbal form.

guilty_plea.source: Before his trial, this defendant reconsidered in light of the additional evidence against him and indicated a plea. He has pleaded guilty before me today

starting_point.source: I intend to take a starting point of 6 years and 3 months’ imprisonment

sentence_after_role.source: Inferred as starting point since role adjustment not provided

notional_sentence.source: For Count 2, I take the same starting point as Count 1

final_sentence.source: For Count 2, this defendant is sentenced to 4 years and 4 months’ imprisonment.
